article.name: Dashboard Overview
article.title: Dashboard Overview
article.body:
The Dashboard tab provides an overview of several features available in your KnowBe4 console. These features include your organization's risk score, phishing, training, Phish Alert Button, and recommended tools.

Note: If you have access to the widgetized dashboard feature, you can customize the widgets that appear on your dashboard. For more information, see our Customize Your Widgetized Dashboard article.

Organization's Risk Score

The Organization's Risk Score widget shows an overview of your organization's Risk Score for the last six months. See more information about Risk Scores and how they're calculated in our SmartRisk Agent™ and Risk Score Guide.

Phishing

The Phishing widget shows an overview of your organization's Phish-prone Percentage for the last six months. You can compare this information with industry-specific benchmarking data. See more information about benchmarking data in our Industry Benchmarking Overview article.

See the Reporting section of our Phishing Campaigns Overview article for more information.

Phish Alert Button

If you have enabled our Phish Alert Button (PAB), this widget shows how many times the PAB was installed or uninstalled, how many emails were reported by your users, and whether those reported emails were simulated or non-simulated.

You can also quickly access your PAB settings by clicking the gear icon in the top-right corner of the PAB widget. See our Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual for more information.

To download the information shown on the PAB widget, click the Generate CSV link in the bottom-right corner of the widget.

Learner Platform Data

The Learner Platform Data widget displays the percentage of training your users have completed by platform over the last 30 days. If you have enabled the KnowBe4 Learner App, this widget will include information about training completed on the app. If you have not enabled the KnowBe4 Learner App, this widget will only include information about training completed on mobile and desktop browsers.

You can also quickly access Learner Platform Reports by clicking the report icon in the top-right corner of the widget. For more information, see our Reporting Guide.

Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA)

The Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA) widget compares your organization's average SAPA score to an average industry-specific SAPA score. The graph on the SAPA widget shows the average score for each of the seven SAPA knowledge areas.

For more information about SAPA benchmarking data, see our Industry Benchmarking Overview article.

For general information about the SAPA, see our Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA) Overview article.

Security Culture Survey (SCS)

The Security Culture Survey (SCS) widget compares your users' most recent SCS scores to an average industry-specific SCS score. The graph on the SCS widget shows the average score for each SCS dimension.

For more information about SCS benchmarking data, see our Industry Benchmarking Overview article.

For general information about the SCS, see our Security Culture Survey (SCS) Overview article.

Training

The Training widget shows the current status of your active training campaigns as well as the percentage of enrolled users who have completed that training.

You can also quickly access all of your Training Campaigns or Create a New campaign using the buttons in the top-right corner of the Training widget. See our Training Campaigns Guide for more information.

At the bottom of the widget, you will find an enrollment link to copy and send to your users. This link will take users to a login page where they can access their enrolled training. The link is specific to the domain indicated, so users must have an email address that uses the same domain.

Tools

The Tools widget shows recommended tools like the Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP) and the Environment Survey.

images.alt:
The image displays a security risk management **Dashboard** interface.

**Header and Navigation:**
The top header is labeled "Dashboard." In the upper right corner, a clickable grid icon is present, typically indicating a view selector or main menu link.

**Main Content Card: Organization's Risk Score**
The primary visualization is presented within a card titled "Organization's Risk Score."

1.  **Composite Risk Score Gauge (Left Panel):**
    *   The overall risk score is **38.8**.
    *   This score is mapped onto a horizontal, color-coded gauge, where the organizational available range is specified as **10.0 - 90.0**.
    *   The gauge uses a color gradient from **Low Risk** (Green) to **Critical Risk** (Red).
    *   A blue, hyperlink-formatted question is included below the gauge: "How does SmartRisk Agent™ calculate my Risk Score?"

2.  **Security Types Breakdown (Right Panel):**
    *   A section titled "Security Types" lists eight categories with corresponding scores and recent movement, displayed using horizontal bar charts.
    *   The scores are numerical (e.g., **18.1**), followed by a green downward arrow and a green value indicating a positive change (decrease in score/risk).
    *   **Data Categories and Scores:**
        *   Email Security: 18.1 ↓ 2.03
        *   Endpoint Security: 4.3 ↓ 0.58
        *   Data Security: 4.6 ↓ 0.83
        *   Web Security: 4.3 ↓ 1.17
        *   Account Hygiene: 3.8 ↓ 0.71
        *   Compliance: (Score visualization implied, text missing)
        *   Electives: 2.5 ↓ 1.24
        *   Physical Security: 1.3 ↓ 0.62

This image displays a security dashboard focused on **Phishing Security Test results** over the **Last 6 Months**. The interface is split into a primary data visualization area and a contextual control/metrics sidebar.

## Primary Visualization (Phishing Security Tests - Last 6 Months)

The main visualization is a combined stacked bar chart and line graph showing results across six sequential tests.

*   **Axes:** The left Y-axis plots "Phish-prone %" (0% to 40%). The right Y-axis plots "Total User Actions" (0 to 200).
*   **Line Graph:** A black line tracks the "Phish-prone %" for each test, showing a decline from approximately 32% to 0%.
*   **Stacked Bars:** Represent the volume of user actions, categorized by a detailed legend listing eleven metrics (e.g., Clicks, Replies, Attachments Opened, Data Entered, Reported).
*   **Aggregate Data Summary:** Key actions are summarized above the chart: "421 Clicks, 22 Replies, 69 Attachments Opened, 1 Macro Enabled, 144 Data Entered, 56 QR Codes Scanned, 0 Callback, 0 Callback Data Entered, 78 Reported."
*   **Benchmark Display:** A dashed blue horizontal line, labeled "Industry Average" in the legend, is present at the 30% mark, representing the industry benchmark data.

## Sidebar Controls and Metrics

The right sidebar provides key performance indicators and filtration options, categorized into two sections:

### 1. Your Organization

| Metric | Value |
| :--- | :--- |
| Account Average Phish-prone % | 13.5% |
| Last Campaign Phish-prone % | 0% |

### 2. Industry Benchmark Data

This section features controls for defining the comparison data set:

*   **Toggle:** A switch labeled "Show in chart" is active (blue), corresponding to the presence of the benchmark line in the graph.
*   **Industry Phish-prone %:** Displays the benchmark value of **30%**.
*   **Filters (Dropdowns):**
    *   **Industry:** Set to "All Industries".
    *   **Organization Size:** Set to "Medium (250-1000 users)".
    *   **Program Maturity:** Set to "Baseline".

A button at the top right of the application header allows the user to **"Hide Industry Benchmark Data"**.
images.context: 4.com/hc/en-us/articles/360051262754'>Phishing Campaigns Overview article for more information.

images.alt:
This image displays a dashboard segment titled "Phish Alert Button," focused on security reporting metrics and trend comparison.

**UI Elements and Context:**
*   **Header:** The title is "Phish Alert Button." The top-right corner includes two standard action icons: a list view/menu icon and a gear/settings icon.
*   **Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):** A row of five summary metrics is displayed above the chart:
    1.  **155** Installed
    2.  **31** Uninstalled
    3.  **314** Total Reported
    4.  **97** Simulated Emails
    5.  **217** Non-Simulated Emails

**Data Visualization (Phish Alert Report Comparison):**
*   **Chart Title:** "Phish Alert Report Comparison"
*   **Timeframe:** "Last 30 days"
*   **Type:** A multi-series vertical bar chart comparing daily reported email volumes.
*   **Y-Axis:** Labeled "Emails Reported," scaled from 0 to 20, with increments marked at 5, 10, 15, and 20.
*   **X-Axis:** Displays daily dates spanning from **04/08/2024** to **05/06/2024**.
*   **Legend:** Identifies the two distinct data series:
    *   Light Blue: **Simulated**
    *   Dark Blue/Indigo: **Non Simulated**

**Action Button:**
*   The bottom right corner features a green action link labeled "**Generate CSV**" accompanied by a download icon, indicating data export functionality.
images.context: om/hc/en-us/articles/208969608'>Phish Alert Button (PAB) Product Manual for more information.

images.alt:
This UI segment, titled "Learner Platform Data," presents a comparative analysis of training module completion based on the platform used. The display is split into a visualization component (left) and a numerical summary (right).

**Left Panel: Horizontal Bar Chart**

*   **Title:** "Training by Platform – 30 Days"
*   **Y-Axis:** Lists three training platforms: "Desktop Browser," "Mobile Browser," and "KnowBe4 Learner App."
*   **X-Axis:** Labeled "Percent of Training," scaled from 0 to 100 in increments of 10.
*   **Data:** All three platform bars (dark gray, representing "Completed") extend to approximately 33-35% completion.
*   **Legend:** A single entry showing a dark gray circle labeled "Completed."

**Right Panel: Numerical Summary**

*   **Title:** "Number of Completed Modules"
*   **Data Points (Absolute Count):**
    *   Desktop Browser: 177
    *   Mobile Browser: 179
    *   KnowBe4 Learner App: 186
*   **Contextual Note:** A footer below the data states: "This data includes all training completed by learners, including optional learning, policies, and assessments."

**Overall UI Elements**

*   A standard blue icon representing a line graph is located in the top right corner of the segment.
*   The data displayed reflects a 30-day reporting period.
images.context: include information about training completed on mobile and desktop browsers.

images.alt:
This image displays the results page for a **Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA)**, comparing an organization's performance against industry benchmarks.

**Title and Overall Context:**
*   **Main Title:** Security Awareness Proficiency Assessment (SAPA)
*   **Action Button (Top Right):** "Hide Industry Benchmark Data" (paired with a toggle icon).

**Primary Visualization (SAPA Score Per Knowledge Area):**
*   A grouped bar chart titled **"SAPA Score Per Knowledge Area"** (Subtitle: "Average for Completed Organizational Assessments").
*   **Y-Axis:** SAPA Score (ranging from 0 to 100).
*   **X-Axis Categories (Knowledge Areas):** Email Security, Human Firewall, Incident Reporting, Internet Use, Mobile Devices, Passwords and Authentication, and Social Media.
*   **Legend:** The chart compares two data series:
    *   Orange Bar: Your Organization
    *   Dark Grey Bar: Industry Benchmark

**Scorecard Panel (Right Sidebar):**
The right panel provides quantitative summaries and benchmark filtering options:

1.  **Your Organization Segment:**
    *   **Organization's SAPA Score:** 62.9% (Displayed prominently in orange).

2.  **Industry Benchmark Data Segment:**
    *   **Industry SAPA Score:** 65.6% (Displayed prominently in dark grey).
    *   **Industry Filter (Dropdown):** Currently set to "All Industries."
    *   **Organization Size Filter (Dropdown):** Currently set to "Medium (250-1000 us)."
images.context: The graph on the SAPA widget shows the average score for each of the seven SAPA knowledge areas.

images.alt:
The image displays a dashboard presenting Security Culture Survey (SCS) results, contrasting organizational data with industry benchmarks.

**Primary UI Elements and Data:**

1.  **Header:** Titled "Security Culture Survey (SCS)."
2.  **Main Visualization (Left):** A horizontal bar chart titled "SCS Score Per Dimension (Average for Completed Surveys)."
    *   **Dimensions (Y-Axis):** Attitudes, Behavior, Cognition, Communication, Compliance, Norms, and Responsibility.
    *   **Scores (X-Axis):** Labeled "SCS Score," ranging from 0 to 100.
    *   **Key:** Orange bars represent "Your Organization," and dark grey bars represent "Industry Benchmark."
3.  **Benchmark Toggle (Top Right):** A clickable control labeled "Hide Industry Benchmark Data."

**Sidebar Data Panel (Right):**

The panel is divided into two sections displaying aggregate scores:

1.  **Your Organization:**
    *   **Metric:** Organization's SCS Score.
    *   **Value:** **67%** (displayed prominently in orange text).
2.  **Industry Benchmark Data:** (Includes an information icon)
    *   **Metric:** Industry SCS Score.
    *   **Value:** **73**.
    *   **Filter:** A dropdown menu labeled "Industry," currently set to **"All Industries"**, allowing users to specify the benchmark criteria.
images.context: The graph on the SCS widget shows the average score for each SCS dimension.

images.alt:
This UI segment, titled "Training" (H1), displays a list of "Recent Campaigns in Progress."

**Header and Actions:**
The header contains two primary action buttons in the upper right corner: 'See All Campaigns' (secondary/outline button) and '+ New Campaign' (primary/solid blue button).

**Campaign List (Five Entries):**
The body of the screen lists five ongoing training campaigns. Each entry features a blue icon (indicating statistical or educational content), the campaign title, and a completion status represented by both a percentage and a horizontal progress bar (blue fill).

| Campaign Title | Completion Status |
| :--- | :--- |
| Security Culture Survey | 55% Completed |
| Security Awareness Initiative | 79% Completed |
| Baseline Security Knowledge Assessment | 73% Completed |
| Optional Content | 39% Completed |
| Onboarding Training | 67% Completed |

**User Invitation Link:**
At the bottom, an instructional text guides administrators to "Share this link to invite your users to start their training," followed by the URL `https://demo.knowbe4.com/ui/login` and a copy-to-clipboard icon.

This image displays a section of a web application titled **Tools** (H2 heading). The section features two distinct, card-based UI elements, each representing an available program or feature, with associated descriptions and a primary Call-to-Action (CTA) button.

**Section 1: Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP)**

*   **Heading:** Start your Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP).
*   **Icon:** An orange security awareness icon (stylized open box with checkmark/arrow).
*   **Description:** Text explaining that ASAP helps create a customized Security Awareness Program by generating a recommended schedule of tasks based on user goals.
*   **CTA Button:** A primary blue button labeled **Get Started**, right-aligned with the description text.

**Section 2: Environment Survey**

*   **Heading:** Environment Survey.
*   **Icon:** An orange icon depicting a stylized laptop screen displaying binary digits ("010").
*   **Description:** Text detailing that the optional survey collects data on organizational security, training, and user management systems to plan future integrations and provide relevant KnowBe4 updates.
*   **CTA Button:** A primary blue button labeled **Get Started**, right-aligned with the description text.
